channel.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
channel.description:
Patrick, Can I use a browser other than Tor Browser on Whonix? (like regular Firefox or Brave)? (to then route this through a VPN through Tor). For the purpose of hiding from a website that I am using Tor.
I am aware that if I use this same VPN for over 10 minutes, it can lead to de-anonymization over time as it can see my Tor Exit nodes changing. I am also aware of my vulnerability to Javascript, but this website requires me to use javascript anyway, so does NoScript even help me if I'm using "safer" or "standard" modes?
Also, couldn't I just put No-script add-on on new firefox?

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Instructions how to do that are linked from that wiki page.

Whonix – 9 Jan 22

Utilize Search Engines and Documentation

Avoid basic questions. Effective use of search engines. Utilizing extensive Whonix ™ documentation.

Read full topic

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
item.dc:creator: cloudymoon3626
item.description:
Thanks for linking high quality documentation and creating such a great platform. Do you have documentation on how to actually do the Tor->>Dedicated IP VPN ? The documentation you provided (while extremely useful) only goes over the risks.

Read full topic

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix – 17 Feb 22

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Read full topic

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
item.dc:creator: cloudymoon3626
item.description:
Yes I clearly see in the documentation that Tor Browser is far superior to just using Tor. However if a website bans Tor, there is no other option than VPN through Tor. I understand it is inferior, I am asking if it is technically possible to do in Whonix? If so, how?

I put brave browser on whonix and it won’t even connect to the internet

Read full topic

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
cloudymoon3626:

Can I use a browser other than Tor Browser on Whonix?

Answered here:

Whonix – 18 Feb 22

Tor Browser Essentials

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

cloudymoon3626:

Also, couldn’t I just put No-script add-on on new firefox?

You very most likely won’t be able to replicate Tor Browser’s protections in any other browsers. Also elaborated in above wiki page.

cloudymoon3626:

does NoScript even help me if I’m using “safer” or “standard” modes?

Same as Tor Browser. Unspecific to Whonix.

Whonix – 26 Jan 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Read full topic

item.title: Proxy or VPN through Tor
